banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: How complex global organizations are adapting to our new reality

nodes.whoTheyAre: As President and CEO of the Project Management Institute (PMI), Sunil Prashara is the lead advocate for a global organization serving more than three million professionals working in nearly every country of the world.
Sally Kohn searches for common ground among political foes by focusing on the compassion and humanity in everyone.
nodes.whyListen:
Sally Kohn has a powerful vision for a more united United States. She's an activist, writer and author of The Opposite of Hate: A Field Guide To Repairing Our Humanity. She is also on the USA Today Board of Contributors and has been a regular contributor on CNN, Fox News and MSNBC.
A progressive lesbian, Kohn has sparred with some of the most conservative minds on television and sifted through tons of hate mail each day. But she deeply believes in finding our common humanity amidst our political and cultural differences -- the only way any of us can hope to learn, grow and change.

Interested in booking Sally Kohn to speak at your event? Check out the TED Speakers Bureau to learn more.

videoData.description: We're experiencing an unprecedented time of transformation, and organizations must now reinvent themselves to survive. Sunil Prashara of the Project Management Institute sits down with TED curator Sally Kohn to discuss which global organizations are doing it best -- and how. (Recorded May 27, 2020)
videoData.socialDescription: We're experiencing an unprecedented time of transformation, and organizations must now reinvent themselves to survive. Sunil Prashara of the Project Management Institute sits down with TED curator Sally Kohn to discuss which global organizations are doing it best -- and how. (Recorded May 27, 2020)
